poem:
**The Morning News**

Macron, in Egypt's light,  
dismisses calls to resign,  
his words crisp as a croissant,  
fresh on a Paris morning.  

Opponents, shadows of the Louvre,  
stir the Seine with whispers,  
yet he sails above them—  
a ship against the tide,  
charting his own course  
through the storm of words.
